chi.meanings: In the physical sciences, an energy transfer or 'energy exchange' from one system to another is said to occur when an amount of energy crosses the boundary between them, thus increasing the energy content of one system while decreasing the energy content of the other system by the same amount.

ji.meanings: Jí is the Mandarin pinyin romanization of the Chinese surname written in Chinese character. It is romanized as Chi in Wade–Giles, and Gat in Cantonese. Ji is the 195th most common surname in China, with a population of 490,000.

sha.meanings: The Secure Hash Algorithm is a family of cryptographic hash functions published by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) as a U.S. Federal Information Processing Standard.

wuxing.meanings: The Wu Xing, also known as the Five Elements, Five Phases, the Five Agents, the Five Movements, Five Processes, and the Five Steps/Stages, is a fivefold conceptual scheme that many traditional Chinese fields used to explain a wide array of phenomena, from cosmic cycles to the interaction between internal organs, and from the succession of political regimes to the properties of medicinal drugs.

yinyang.meanings: In Chinese philosophy, yin and yang, which are often shortened to "yin-yang" or "yin yang", are concepts used to describe how apparently opposite or contrary forces are actually complementary, interconnected and interdependent in the natural world, and how they give rise to each other as they interrelate to one another. Many tangible dualities (such as light and dark, high and low, hot and cold, fire and water, life and death, male and female, sun and moon, and so on) are thought of as physical manifestations of the duality of yin and yang.

tips.name: Glamour Photo
tips.problem:
Photographs are a great way to increase the positive chi in your living space and bring your environment into alignment with your true self and your goals.
However, images of single people in the bedroom can indicate loneliness. It's possible to feel lonely and insecure even if you're married.
To correct this, hang a picture of a couple or display pairs of objects.
tips.reminder: I love taking photos and display them above my bed!

birds.name: Flock Of Birds
birds.description: To make your living environment feeling secure, and not too lonely for a single person, hang a picture of a couple or display pairs of objects to enhance the feng shui energy.

fish.name: Flock Of Fish
fish.description: To make your living environment feeling secure, and not too lonely for a single person, hang a picture of a couple or display pairs of objects to enhance the feng shui energy.

leaves.name: Leaves
leaves.description: To make your living environment feeling secure, and not too lonely for a single person, hang a picture of a couple or display pairs of objects to enhance the feng shui energy.

tips.name: Chair
tips.problem: The chair, on which you sit, should be located in the right position so as to retain the energy of your body. If you sit between two doors or, between a door and a window or, if your chair is aligned with a door, then your body energy can drain quickly due to ‘yang activity‘.
tips.advice:
Now the chair is located in the right position that sits away from the door or windows.
Always try to avoid sitting with your back to the door or a window if you can.
tips.reminder: Oh, sorry! The chair in the middle of the room blocks your way. Maybe I should move it somewhere else.

tips.name: Light
tips.problem: Cold lights mostly give rise to stress, tension and a lot of negative energy, which is why, it should not be used in a recreation area. Instead, warm color lights should be selected.
tips.reminder: I love novels and makeup magazines, but sometimes I feel tired after reading for a while.

pink.name: Pink Light
pink.description: Pink is the color of love in accordance with the feng shui belief. It is linked with positive factors like longevity, health, and abundance, which is why pink light work so well to re-ignite passion in a relationship. It is important to note here that these characteristics are not associated with any reddish shade of pink; the shade can be prove to be too stimulating.

yellow.name: Yellow Light
yellow.description:
Another warm color to consider is the yellow shade of sunlight. Sunny colors are associated with positive and cheerful attributes and emotions.
Apart from this, it has a soothing effect which can lighten the sourest of moods and make a person feel good.

orange.name: Orange Light
orange.description:
The feng shui philosophy marks orange as the ‘social’ color, as this color helps to encourage conversations.
This color serves as a reminder of summers, during winters.

tips.name: Crystal
tips.advice:
Feng shui crystals are used for various purposes and can benefit the user by enhancing the flow of energy in different areas of an office or the house. Apart from this, they are also well known for their energizing abilities.
One of the attributes of crystal is that it stores the energy from sunlight and distributes it as positive energy in the form of rainbows. It is because of this property, that these crystals are placed near windows.
tips.reminder: I got a crystal as a gift, does it has any Feng Shui function? I display it above the vanity cabinet.

tips.name: Clock
tips.advice:
Clocks are important furniture with every home and office. A working clock that is also attractive indicates positivity and harmony in the environment.
Placing a clock in your career area will promote good business and increase your wealth and business opportunities. Good feng shui areas to freely display the clocks are the kitchen, the living room, or the home office.
tips.reminder: What time is it now?

tips.name: Window
tips.problem: You can easily understand how energy enters your home by imagining it as a stream of gushing water flowing in. The water needs to flow freely and should not be allowed to stagnate, it might compromise the flow of positive energy otherwise.
tips.advice: Be sure that direct alignment of doors and windows are avoided, which creates rushing energy. The best choice is to create a meandering, graceful and balanced energy flow.
tips.reminder: My room is small, so I try to open the windows more often, but I still feel suffocated.

tips.name: Indoor Plants
tips.problem: The art of feng shui lays great emphasis on plants. In accordance with it, plants are the source of lively energy and are absolutely crucial for one’s office space as well as homes. There are, however, plants which are termed as ‘bad’ feng shui representation. One such plant is the cactus due to its ‘spiky’ energy.
tips.reminder: I love my “little green”, and cactus leaves also offer health benefits, right?

descriptions.lucky-bamboo: Bamboo is considered to be the transmitter of wise and harmonious energy as it serves to teach a fundamental lesson, namely the importance of adopting a flexible and an open approach to life.
descriptions.orchid: The orchid blooms throughout the year and they are popularly used to attract new partners as opposed to bamboos which are used to strengthen existing relationships. These plants have the capability to take in carbon dioxide and to diffuse oxygen at night. This property of the plant makes it ideal for bedrooms as it facilitates sleep and maintains a comfortable environment.
descriptions.rubberplant: The ivy plant teaches patience, continuity and the power of friendship. This is because Ivy has the ability of stick on to different objects and structures. It serves to control substances like formaldehyde from carpets and paint, as well as the harmful chemicals found in plastic and ink.

tips.name: Sharp Objects
tips.problem: According to the feng shui beliefs, objects which are pointed in nature and appear to be sharp are transmitters of ‘sha energy’. Such objects serve to induce negative energy in a household and stimulate tension and stress leading to a rise in blood pressure.
tips.advice: If there is a sharp object towards you or near you, always cover it up by placing a cover or something in front of it.
tips.reminder: Fashion design and handcrafts are my favorites. I especially enjoy working with a sewing machine.

tips.name: Fruits
tips.problem: Feng shui ideology encourages home owners to display fruits in their homes. It is best to make use of these fresh fruits for their specific energies in feng shui philosophy.
tips.reminder: How do you like fresh fruit? I have some stored in the refrigerator.

tips.name: Fruits
tips.problem: Feng shui ideology encourages home owners to display fruits in their homes. This is because its scriptures clearly highlight the fact that fruits are viewed as symbols of fertility, success, wealth, longevity etc.
tips.reminder: I recently bought a new fruit plate.
tips.hint: Something is missing on the fruit plate. Could you find them?

apple.name: The Apple
apple.description: Apple symbolizes harmony and peace which makes it ideal for households.

pineapple.name: The Pineapple
pineapple.description: We have the pineapple. Scrumtious and full of positive goodness, the word sounds like the Chinese one for “good luck coming your way”.

peach.name: The Peach
peach.description: The peach signifies longevity, wealth and health.

orange.name: The Orange
orange.description: Oranges are well known for their revitalizing scent and color of the fruit has positive attributes or ‘yang’.

tips.name: Closet
tips.problem:
You cannot cover, conceal or pretend not to see low energy, because in the world of feng shui energy, there are no boundaries.
Here is the thing about closets - most people think of closets as an out of sight, out of mind deal. Clutter should be clean and organized.
tips.advice:
A disorganized space is one that wastes and even eliminates positive energy. Trying to overlook this will not do any good since there are no limits to feng shui.
It is, therefore, advised that there should be no mess inside a house, as being organized will prove to be beneficial for both body and mind.
tips.reminder: I always have a really rushed morning. I don’t have time to organize the closet.

tips.name: Lotus
tips.advice: The lotus plant remains pristine regardless of the mud it grows in. This plant has many medical attributes attached to it, which is why the Chinese make use of each part to create medicine. This quality makes it an ideal energy purifier for bathrooms.
tips.reminder: Do you like my flower vase? I think it brings a fresh mood to the bathroom.

tips.name: Water Leakage
tips.problem: Any kind of water leaks symbolize a deteriorating household or financial condition. It is very important that all such leaks are filled and taken care of in order to avoid excess expenditure.
tips.advice: Water problems can lead to the loss of wealth. Any leaking, dripping, or seeping water in your environment can represent hemorrhaging in your home or business financial picture. The cure to perform is very simple: Stop up all your leaks, while visualizing that your expenditures are now under control and not leaking out in known or unknown ways.
tips.reminder: Oh... somewhere is leaking? Maybe I should have tap the shower head!

tips.name: Goldfish
tips.problem: You will want to always clean the fish tank immediately, and refill it with new goldfish as soon as possible.
tips.advice:
The presence of fish symbolizes the energy associated with the flow of water. In the scriptures of feng shui water is associated with wealth and success.
The idea of greater wealth is also connected to the reproductive capabilities of fish, because they are able to reproduce significantly in a very short time.
tips.reminder: We had a goldfish, but it passed away a few months ago. We left the empty fish bowl near the sofa.

tips.name: Mirror
tips.advice:
The values of feng shi place some reservations on the presence of mirrors. This, however, does not mean that mirrors should be avoided. It should be placed in areas where it reflects something pleasant and comforting.
For instance, the mirror reflects pleasant dishes, amplifies the natural light in the room and enhances the healthy chi energy that can bring riches for the whole family.
tips.reminder: I heard that mirrors have some unexpected Feng Shui influences. Is that true? Have I used it correctly?

tips.name: Cooking Utensils
tips.problem: Knives are inherently as “Sha” (bad luck) in Feng shui so it will disturb the energy flow in your kitchen. You should never keep knives out on the countertop or hanging on the wall in your home if you have young children.
tips.advice: There are some cooking utensils, like knives, which transmit the ‘sha’ energy or bad luck. This sort of energy flow needs to be stopped from flowing through the kitchen. This is, therefore, advised that knives should not be left hanging from walls, or on tops of counters. The best place to store knives is in covered areas like drawers.
tips.reminder: My husband Scott always displays cooking utensils on the countertop. But I really like to keep them organized in a drawer.

tips.name: Kitchen Utensils
tips.hint: Certain kitchen utensils are better put into the drawer...
tips.problem: Knives are inherently as “Sha” (bad luck) in Feng shui so it will disturb” the energy flow in your kitchen. You should never keep knives out on the countertop or hanging on the wall in your home if you have young children.
tips.advice: Ideally, knives are best kept in drawers. Yes, they probably came in a beautiful counter top knife block, but it is not good Feng shui to have knives so easily accessible. Thus, please always hide the sharp objects to avoid “Sha” energy.
tips.reminder: My husband Scott always displays cooking utensils on the countertop. But I really like to keep them organized in a drawer.

tips.name: Bookshelf
tips.advice:
If you have book shelves, they need to be organized and well maintained. Stacking books on shelves, in the form of a miniature library is a very good way to be organized.
Keeping a lot of books in the living room are not a very good idea as they might take a lot of space. This, however, does not mean that a small amount of books, in the living room, is a bad idea.
tips.reminder: The half-wall book stack shelf is the most significant decoration in our living room, but we actually seldom read those books.

tips.name: Electronic Devices
tips.problem: The beliefs of feng shui categorize the modern electronic gadgets as ‘jin’ elements. ‘Jin’ elements are not well suited inside a bedroom because they are characterized by sharp metal objects.
tips.advice: The modern electronic gadgets, in other words as 'Jin' elements, cause hindrance in a child’s sleep patterns. It is, therefore, advised that the use of these electronic devices should be avoided by children especially before going to bed.
tips.reminder: I love to play with my handheld console! I put it near my bed so I can reach it at night!

tips.name: Plush Toys
tips.problem: In feng shui, the plush toys are symbolism as human beings and they should be treated as friends. Please find him a better place than the drawer.
tips.advice:
The art of feng shui, views plush toys as imitations of human beings which can be taken as friends, which is why having them in a room is not an issue.
The issue, however, is the place where they are kept. Plush toys should appear in open spaces where they get a chance to breathe. Storing them in cabinets may promote negative energy.
tips.reminder: Dad said I need to clean my room, so I threw my bear, Nick King, into a drawer, but I don’t think he liked it.

tips.name: Study Area
tips.problem:
The table on which a child studies should be arranged in a manner that the child’s back is towards a window and table is facing the room.
The window may cause easy distractions for a child.
tips.advice:
To facilitate study, it is best to have the child faced to the wall.
The shift helps him feel more empowered and on top of his work. They will be less affected by distractions.
tips.reminder: There is a playground outside my window. I hope I can finish my homework soon and join Tom and Ryan.

tips.name: Poster
tips.problem:
A child’s bedroom should be free from posters of wild and dangerous animals as these images generate a lot of negative energy.
Instead, a child’s room should be a place, where one could relax. Any violent or aggressive images may result in insufficient healing.
tips.reminder: Do you like that picture hanging on my wall?

family.name: Photo of Family
family.description: According to feng shui philosophy the bond between parents and children can be strengthened in a healthy environment. Furthermore, a healing environment tends to have a positive effect on a person’s relationship and it paves the floor for his or her success.

hug.name: Photo of Family Moment
hug.description: According to feng shui philosophy the bond between parents and children can be strengthened in a healthy environment. Furthermore, a healing environment tends to have a positive effect on a person’s relationship and it paves the floor for his or her success.

tips.name: Sitting Area
tips.problem: The feng shui ideology dictates that one must be seated at a distance from the door while making sure that his or her back is not towards it.
tips.advice: In a situation where a table cannot be placed at a distance from the door, then a mirror should be placed on the wall in form of a seat. This will allow you to be vigilant and to constantly maintain a watchful eye on the entrance. A chair with a high back may also be required in due time.
tips.reminder: Have a seat! Try this desk chair, it’s very comfortable! But I don’t know why I sometimes get backaches.

tips.name: Photo Display
tips.problem:
In order to create a fostering environment in your office, it is essential that you decorate your walls with mottos, images, and pictures such that they motivate you to achieve your life goal.
It always helps to acknowledge the people who have provided you with support throughout. This acknowledgment would involve placing pictures of your family, along with that of your mentors.
One, however, needs to be careful because placing too many pictures might cause distractions.
Be sure to place the kind of images that are a source of inspiration for you and are somehow linked to your business.
tips.reminder: Any suggestions on the picture wall? I’ve heard that Feng Shui can help with my career.

family.name: Photo of Family
family.description: It is always a great idea to display family photos to connect to your happy family times.

hug.name: Photo of Family Moment
hug.description: The photo of a dad and son could symbolize growth of the young and harmony in his household.

lecture.name: Photo of Career
lecture.description: The picture of career success will motivate you to achieve your life goal.

degree.name: Photo of Achievements
degree.description: The picture of graduation will make it easier for the person to adjust to the new stage in life, as well as help him make the best of the changes and challenges that the future may hold.

tips.name: Sharp Decorations
tips.problem: Sha Chi travels in straight lines. If you have some sharp angles and corners around you, pointed you or near to where you spend most of your time, these can be considered sources of harmful influences.
tips.advice: Sharp edges and corners can cause you some problems and may be a source of negative experiences. This is why it is advised to move around these and in order to enhance the situation’s feng shui. You can dramatically improve the Feng shui of this situation by moving around those sharp objects.
tips.reminder: I always need set square. Do you think it is in a good position now? I want to keep it at hand.

tips.name: Office Plants
tips.advice:
If you have to face a wall in your workspace, you can dramatically improve the feng shui of this situation by having some green plants, or pictures of it.
Making the environment lively is your goal and be sure this is possible with appropriate feng shui cures.
tips.reminder: I love having some plants in the room. Do you think I have made a wise choice?

tips.name: Desktop Screen
tips.advice:
Flowing water represents prosperity and wealth. This rings true in society at large as well.
It is very helpful to have a flowing water fountain at your front door, or the door you enter your home or office most. If you cannot build a pond or fountain then images of flowing water will do. For example, set your computer wallpaper or screensaver to be images of great flowing waterfalls with sunlight.
tips.reminder: Do you like my desktop wallpaper?

tips.name: Cat
tips.advice:
There is a reason cats are known as fortunate felines when it comes to feng shui ideology.
It is important that you treat your cat in a nice way and do a little extra for it. This extra effort would include developing a small area which is just for your cat, which should be furnished with a cushion or perhaps a small bed. This small gesture will have a positive impact on your cat and this in turn will have a very good influence on your entire household. It is essential to pick a good spot for your cat and that spot should be cleaned regularly.
tips.reminder: Did you hear the sweet snozzing sound? That's our kitty Tom!

livingroom.title: Welcome to my studio!
livingroom.paragraph:
My name is Ollie and I am a fashion designer. This is my apartment. Welcome!
I love photos and plants and handcrafts. I wish I had someone to truly share my hobbies with... especially when I feel so alone at times.
If you have any suggestions on improving my workspace to make it fun and happier, it would be great!

bathroom.title: This is my bathroom..
bathroom.paragraph:
After a whole day working, I really enjoy soaking in the bath in the early mornings and late nights.
Ideally, the bathroom should be serene, clean and comfortable. Somewhere totally relaxed. What can we do to make this a more refreshing place?

livingroom.title: Welcome to my house!
livingroom.paragraph:
My name is Joanna. Welcome to our house. Isn’t it a very nice living room? How can we make it even better?
We spend a great deal of time here, and I hope that the living room can provide more wealth and prosperity for my family. We would also like to improve my husband’s workplace and provide a positive learning environment for Nick.

corridor.title: Say Hi to Scott and Nick?
corridor.paragraph:
Hi, there! Feel free to explore the second floor of my house.
Walk through the corridor you will find my husband Scott's office and my lovely boy, Nick. They want some advice too.

boysroom.title: Hey, this is my room.
boysroom.paragraph:
I am almost 6 now, and I will start school next September. I don’t really want to go to school… Mom said I would have to spend more time studying in the future.
I am a big gamer, and here is the new computer I just got! When I grow up, I will travel around the world just like Superman.

homeoffice.title:
Welcome to
my home office!
homeoffice.paragraph:
I am sure you have been a great help for Joanna and Nick! Working for a university mathematics department can be very stressful. Sometimes I hope that I can totally relax in my home office.
What sorts of things we can do here?

studio.title: Ollie says thank you!
studio.paragraph:
You have helped me solve all the Feng Shui problems in my studio! We have replaced the cactus with a broadleaf plant, brightened the living area, and smoothed out the energy flow. The bathroom has no hidden areas now.
Thank you very much! It was a really pleasant experience! So now, would you like to stay for a review, or are you up to visit the next location?

house.title: Thanks for your help!
house.paragraph:
Now we have a very pleasant living room with a delightful goldfish, a quiet, relaxed and efficient home office, and a fun learning environment for little Nick.
So now, would you like to stay for a review, or are you up to visit the next location?

finale.title: Congratulations!
finale.paragraph: Hi you did great there! Now that you have completed all tasks. It's time to take a rest.
